intro: Crambe pritzelii, commonly known as the yellow crambe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in well-drained soils. Crambe pritzelii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential in sustainable agriculture.
